intro: Hieracium dimorphum, commonly known as the two-form hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium dimorphum is often found in temperate regions and can be an invasive species in some areas.
